pt: {sc}trifle{/sc} {sc}toy{/sc} {sc}dally{/sc} {sc}flirt{/sc} {sc}coquet{/sc} mean to deal with or act toward without serious purpose. {sc}trifle{/sc} may imply playfulness, unconcern, indulgent contempt.
{sc}toy{/sc} implies acting without full attention or serious exertion of one's powers.

pt.t: a political novice {it}toying{/it} with great issues

pt: {sc}dally{/sc} suggests indulging in thoughts or plans merely as an amusement.

pt.t: {it}dallying{/it} with the idea of building a boat someday

pt: {sc}flirt{/sc} implies an interest or attention that soon passes to another object.

pt.t: {it}flirted{/it} with one fashionable ism after another

pt: {sc}coquet{/sc} implies attracting interest or admiration without serious intention.

pt.t: companies that {it}coquet{/it} with environmentalism solely for public relations

pt: {sc}delay{/sc} {sc}procrastinate{/sc} {sc}lag{/sc} {sc}loiter{/sc} {sc}dawdle{/sc} {sc}dally{/sc} mean to move or act slowly so as to fall behind. {sc}delay{/sc} usually implies a putting off of something (such as a beginning or departure).
{sc}procrastinate{/sc} implies blameworthy delay especially through laziness or apathy.
{sc}lag{/sc} implies failure to maintain a speed set by others.
{sc}loiter{/sc} and {sc}dawdle{/sc} imply delay while in progress, especially in walking, but {sc}dawdle{/sc} more clearly suggests an aimless wasting of time.

pt.t: children {it}dawdling{/it} on their way home from school

pt: {sc}dally{/sc} suggests delay through trifling or vacillation when promptness is necessary.

shortdef: to act playfully; especially : to play amorously

dt: {bc}to do or think about (something) in a way that is not serious

dt.t: He's been {it}dallying with{/it} the idea of running for office.

dt: {bc}to have a casual romantic or sexual relationship with (someone)

dt.t: a married man who has been {it}dallying with{/it} another woman
